instruction: Find the equation of the parabola given the focus and directrix
output:
The equation of the parabola given a focus of (2, 4) and a directrix of y=0 is 
y^2 = 12x - 8.

instruction: Cite three non-English sources for a research paper on ancient Greek mythology.
output: Three sources on ancient Greek mythology in non-English languages are La Mitología Griega by María Isabel del Moral León (Spanish), Mitoloji by Yannaras C. (Turkish), and Ελληνική Μυθολογία by Giorgos Eideneier (Greek).

instruction: Identify three differences between the two figures.
output: The three differences between the two figures are: 1) Figure 1 has two eyes, whereas Figure 2 has only one eye; 2) Figure 1 has two arms, whereas Figure 2 has four arms; 3) Figure 1 has a star-shaped body, whereas Figure 2 has a triangular-shaped body.

instruction: Create a report summarizing a book you read.
input: The book “The Great Gatsby” by F. Scott Fitzgerald
output: The Great Gatsby is a novel by American author F. Scott Fitzgerald, first published in 1925. The novel follows the life of Jay Gatsby, a wealthy, yet mysterious man who attempts to win the heart of his long lost love. Along the way, Gatsby deals with difficult relationships, unlawful activities, and conflicting moral issues. The novel shows a vivid illustration of the society of the 1920s and provides a dreamy, romantic and tragic atmosphere. The story begins with Nick Carraway, the protagonist, who has moved to West Egg and becomes neighbors with Gatsby. His perplexity towards Gatsby's unexplained wealth and mysteriousness serves as a gateway to unveil Gatsby's story. Through the adventures of Gatsby and his friends and family, the novel illuminates the many complexities of life, notably with the idea of the pursuit of the American Dream.

instruction: What are the different methods of communication?
output: The different methods of communication includes verbal communication, non-verbal communication, written communication, pictorial communication, electronic communication and body language. Verbal communication involves talking and listening, while non-verbal communication involves facial expressions, gestures and body language. Written communication includes letters, emails, reports and memos. Pictorial communication can be in the form of diagrams, charts, graphs, images and cartoons. Electronic communication includes social media, instant messaging and telephones. Lastly, body language involves the use of gestures, postures and facial expressions to convey messages.

instruction: Compare and contrast conservatism and liberalism.
output: Conservatism is a political ideology that emphasizes traditional values, strength in national defense, and a limited role of the government in society. It advocates for an economy that is ruled by individuals, rather than the government, and leans toward a market economy. Liberals, on the other hand, advocate for an expanded role of the government in society. They are less likely to adhere to traditional values, advocating for civil rights and liberties, as well as a more progressive income tax system. In terms of the economy, liberals emphasize government intervention to promote fairness, justice, and equality. In summary, conservatism is marked by its emphasis on traditional values and limited government intervention, while liberalism emphasizes civil rights, liberties, and government intervention in the economy.

instruction: Subdivide the category "living things" into 3 distinct groups.
output: Living things can be divided into three distinct groups: animals, plants and fungi. Animals are characterized by their ability to move and the presence of a nervous system. Plants are characterized by their ability to make their own food through photosynthesis, and fungi are characterized by their ability to decompose organic material and absorb nutrients from their environment.

instruction: Name three features of the 2020 census.
output: The 2020 census has three key features. First, the census will include the use of the Internet. This means responding to the census will be more convenient and accessible for those who have internet access. Second, the 2020 census will include a new question about citizenship status. This will provide more accurate and reliable information on the citizenship status of US citizens. Third, the 2020 census will make use of more advanced data-collection strategies, such as sampling and aerial photography to determine population counts in remote areas.

instruction: Think of a way to use the following material to build a shelter.
input: 2 sticks and a piece of cloth
output: Using the two sticks, create a makeshift frame or arch, using the cloth as a roof. Secure the cloth with rope, stakes, or weights to make sure the shelter doesn't collapse.

instruction: Generate a job description for a project manager role.
output:
We are looking for an experienced Project Manager to join our team. The ideal candidate should display strong organization and problem-solving skills to ensure that projects are completed in a timely and efficient manner. The Project Manager will be responsible for managing the day-to-day activities of a project and ensuring that deliverables are achieved according to the project plan.

Responsibilities:
• Develop and manage project plans and timelines, remaining in line with budget allocations
• Work with stakeholders to ensure a successful and smooth project execution
• Track and report project performance, ensuring that deadlines are met
• Analyze and report on project risks and changes
• Oversee resolution of issues throughout each stage of the project
• Develop and manage project schedules, ensuring that all deadlines are met
• Develop project plans and communicate them to stakeholders
• Liaise with stakeholders to report project progress and performance
• Facilitate team meetings, providing project updates and resolving any project-related issues
• Produce reports and presentations to communicate project status
• Develop relationships with external vendors and service providers

Requirements:
• Proven project management experience
• Ability to multi-task and prioritize tasks
• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
• Excellent communication and organizational skills
• Experience with budget management
• Knowledge and experience of project management software
• Knowledge of project management techniques and tools
• Project Management Professional (PMP) certification is a plus.

instruction: Compare and contrast the classical Greek and Roman architecture.
output:
The classical architecture of Ancient Greece and Rome have a number of similarities and differences. Both civilizations used the same basic elements of architecture, such as columns, arches, and domes, but their implementations of them were distinct in many ways. 

Greek architecture was characterized by a more restrained use of ornamentation and simpler forms, while Roman architecture was much more ornate and featured more intricate details. Greek architecture favored proportion and harmony in design, while Roman architecture favored a bold grandeur. 

Greek temples, for example, were typically built on a raised platform from a single block of stone and usually featured a single room, while Roman temples were constructed from several different materials and often featured elaborate, multiple-roomed designs. Greek columns were distinct for their tapered shape, while Roman columns were much thicker and featured decorative elements. 

Overall, the main difference between the two architectural styles can be summed up as follows: Greek architecture favored aesthetics and proportion, while Roman architecture favored grandeur and imposing structure.

instruction: Rewrite the instructions given to the recruiters while recruiting new interns.
input: Recruiting new interns involves reviewing resumes, interviewing potential interns, and selecting candidates.
output: Recruiters should evaluate resumes, conduct interviews, and make selections when recruiting new interns. During the interviews, it is important to enquire about potential intern’s qualifications, skills, and interests to determine if they are a good fit for the role. It is also important to ask probing questions to assess their critical thinking, problem solving, and communication skills. It is further necessary to evaluate whether the intern can work well independently and as part of a team. After assessing the applicants, a final selection should be made.

instruction: Generate 100 words summary for the following article
input: COVID-19 has created significant upheavals in the global economy, as has been evidenced by plummeting industrial output, weakened confidence in investments, and other indicators of economic malaise. People have been laid off from their jobs, industries have seen their businesses struggling, and the difficulty of maintaining the physical distancing measures have further hampered global economic growth. Governments have been quick to respond, introducing stimulus packages aimed at stabilizing their economies, while also attempting to mitigate the effects of the pandemic on their people.
output: COVID-19 has caused major downsizing in the global economy, with industrial output decreasing, investors losing confidence, and people losing their jobs. To address these issues, governments have enacted stimulus packages to try and stabilize their economies. But the challenge of maintaining physical distancing has presented further economic difficulties. Moreover, the pandemic has had a tremendous effect on the lives of people, drastically altering their quality of life. The response to this has been encouraging in many countries, and governments are doing their best to counter its crippling effects. However, the long-term consequences of the pandemic are yet to be seen.

instruction: Add 5 new facts to the article.
input: In the United States, the number of workers age 65 and above is projected to double by 2040.
output: In the United States, the number of workers age 65 and above is projected to double by 2040. Additionally, in 2020, older workers represent one quarter of the country's employed labor force, with their participation in the labor force rising from 12.7% in 1979 to 25.3%. By 2040, older workers are expected to make up nearly one-third of the U.S. labor force. Moreover, according to Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS) estimates, the labor force participation rate for those aged 65 and above is expected to rise from its 2020 level of 25% to 32.7% by 2040. Further, older workers are projected to account for 10.6% of the overall labor force growth in the next decade. Additionally, the growth rate of older workers is expected to be more than 3 times that of workers aged 25 to 54.

instruction: Derive a word from the following word: fortitude
output: Fortitudinous.

instruction: Describe a possible use case of the GPT model.
output: One possible use case of the GPT model is to generate natural language content. GPT models can be used to generate creative stories, articles, and blog posts from a given prompt. It can also be used to generate code from sample texts such as API descriptions, as well as to generate system documentation from a software application. GPT models can also be used to augment traditional search engines, helping to deliver more precise search results. In addition, GPT models are also capable of generating natural language queries from structured data, and can be used to assist with customer service inquiries.

instruction: Generate an example input to an instruction that asks the assistant to "write a report on the current status of the global economy".
output:
The global economy is still suffering from the impacts of COVID-19. In 2020, the global economy saw its worst decline since the Great Depression, with global GDP dropping by 4.3%. In 2021, the outlook is more promising, with the International Monetary Fund forecasting that global GDP will grow by 5.5%. 

In the US, the economy has recovered somewhat, with the unemployment rate decreasing from its peak of 14.7% in April 2020 to 6.3% as of February 2021. Consumption and investment have also been on a steady increase. However, continued government spending to support the economy remains an issue, as the US government debt exceeds $28 trillion.

In Europe, the situation is more mixed. while Germany, France, and Russia have seen some signs of recovery, the UK is still in recession. The pandemic has also hit emerging markets especially hard, with countries such as Brazil, India, and Nigeria seeing steep declines in GDP.

Overall, the global economy is slowly recovering, but there is still a long way to go.

instruction: Answer the following physics question: What is the velocity of light in a vacuum?
output: The velocity of light in a vacuum is 299,792,458 meters per second.
